Reviews.Title: Best monitor system on the market. Period.
Reviews.Author: Donielle L.
Reviews.Content: With our first child, I purchased a standard audio-only monitor that was on sale. Despite its short falls and antiquated technology, it did the trick. Things went downhill fast, though - the rechargeable battery on the mobile unit began dying within a few months, making it useless unless it was on the docking station 24/7.Now expecting our second child, I did extensive research into a new monitor system. I knew we would need two cameras (one for each kiddos room), and I wanted them to be able to connect to wifi so we could check-in on them when travelling (preferably through an app with our mobile devices). The typical monitor-systems had too many issues reported by customers and/or Consumer Reports - long lag time, short range, poor customer service, and the ability for tech savy individuals to hack into the digital/analog frequencies.WifiBaby had the best reviews of any consumer site I viewed and had all of the features I was looking for - mobile connectivity, secure stream, remote access, infrared, can view multiple video streams at once, etc. My only hesitation was the price, since I needed two, and having to pay separately for the mobile app (again, twice, since my husband and I do not share the same iTunes account). I'm glad I got over that! WifiBaby is hands-down the best monitor system. My favorite feature is the ability to set the audio sensitivity and squelch-limit so I don't have to listen to the white noise machine in kiddos room! When the noise level surpasses the set threshold, it unmutes so I only hear the pertinent noise!First recommendation - purchase directly from WifiBaby.net because you will get a small discount on each camera unit when purchasing more than one with the same transaction.  Also, shipping is free and 2-day delivery is standard.Second recommendation - take advantage of the WifiBaby Pro support, especially when setting up the remote access. The customer service is AMAZING. I had same-day service and my rep spent over an hour with me getting things working. If you can't set up the remote connection following their directions right away, don't waste any more time (unless you are an IT guru and/or know how to make a gateway through your network firewall).I have recommended this to all of my friends who are expecting or already have children. Best. Thing. Ever.

Reviews.Title: Great setup!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of reviews (on the WiFi Baby 2) refer to setup and configuration.  I thought it was a breeze.  Mind you, I'm more of a techie, but when buying a device that will become a part of your home wireless network, you need to at least know how your network works.  However, if you do not, WiFi Baby provides fantastic guides and has outstanding customer support to get you up and running.I actually turned the wireless off and am using the camera over ethernet and powerline (through the electrical outlets).  If you give your camera a static IP on the network, it makes things easier.  All of this is very easy through the web interface of the camera.  The 2013 model even comes with a built in link that you can use away from home so you do not have to search around for a dynamic DNS service on your own.Although some other non-WiFi wireless baby monitors come with monitors as well, their batteries last for one, maybe two hours at best if using the video.  It is extremely nice to use the family iPad which has a much better battery life.  Streaming any kind of video (YouTube, etc.) will wear down the battery more quickly, but the iPad's battery is as good as you're going to get for a video baby monitor.Pros:Wireless or wiredPreconfigured link for away from home viewingViewable from iOS, Android, or any computer via web interfaceEasy setupFantastic supportAmerican companyiPad as monitor (sound can run in background too!)Multiple camera support - huge for meHave not needed to restart camera yetCons:Pan and tilt would be nice (but not necessary when you think about it and see the large viewing angle)Our cam is near a wall near white curtains and you get a white ring in the night vision due to the reflection from the curtains.  If you point the camera towards the center of the room (away from the curtains), this goes away.  Probably specific to my application but tweaking the placement reduced the effect significantly.We will be buying more of these in the future.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: A. Mccoy "SammieSusa"
Reviews.Content: I got one of these cameras to use as a baby monitor.  I had no trouble getting the camera configured to view on my home wifi connection, but I did have a little trouble setting up the remote viewing so I could still see the video feed when I was away from home.  I went to the Wifi Baby website and set up an appointment time for someone in service to contact me.  The service representative was very punctual, very nice, and very fast!  He told me exactly what I had done wrong and even helped me do it via screen sharing so all I had to do was watch!  It was a totally painless process.  I love that I can even use it as a security-type camera once my children are grown.  Picture and sound totally comparable to the Summer baby monitor I was using before it died on me. So far, I'm a very happy customer and just cannot say enough good things about their customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great Product with 5 Star Plus Support
Reviews.Author: Daniel Wurglitsh "DJ"
Reviews.Content: Great product we use it with our work computers, Android phone, iPhone 5, and iPad 2. So we use all the available technologies. Read below.My wife and I are having our first baby and looking at the reviews of all the cameras out there it seemed like everyone had some type of flaw to it. One big thing is that our friends were always losing the baby monitor or the batteries were dead. Since we always have our phone or ipad we thought this was perfect. We also both work so remote viewing is a MAJOR plus.The item arrived quickly and was installed right away. It worked right off the bat but we had issues port forwarding. My wifi network is somewhat complex with repeaters. As a amateur techie I wanted to resolve the matter myself but just could not get around to it. I submitted a remedy ticket.Within 2 minutes I received an email asking what time would work best for tech support to call. I actually stated anytime today would be perfect. Within less than a minute Gary called. We setup a remote viewing session. I explained to him my very complex situation. He was very kind and could speak English on things than many might not understand. He helped get my remote viewing to work within minutes.He then said, how do you view it, lets set up all your apps. Within a few minutes we got all of them set up. After hanging up he sent an email with his email address offering to help anytime.Excellent A+ Service with an English Speaking tech support who was very friendly. Totally worth all the money.

Reviews.Title: Hard to set up
Reviews.Author: Taranr18
Reviews.Content: I bought this and ended up returning for three reasons. 1. it was very hard to set up and I usually don't have a hard time with technology set ups. I even had two other people try to help me set it up and they couldn't either. Maybe we are idiots but because it took all that just to set it up, it wasn't worth it. 2. once I had it somewhat set up there was a 4 second delay. I couldn't handle it having a delay. 3. If my internet were to go out I wouldn't have a monitor that would work. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Love it so far...
Reviews.Author: Miranda
Reviews.Content: Although we are new to the baby scene, and we just activated our WiFi Baby monitor, it's clear that this a great product. Love the app for the ipad and iphone. The visual and audio quality are fantastic and there are a lot of options to play with. The fact that this can serve as a baby monitor, nanny cam and security cam should help to make this the gift that will keep on giving!Had some initial hiccups with the setup so had to call support. Was so glad I did and highly recommend going this route if not technically savvy. Very pleasant experience and informative. Everything was explained succinctly and the rest of the setup was pretty much a breeze with a little help.Love this product so far and the team that stands behind it!

Reviews.Title: Lots of issues
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be pretty tech savvy, this camera setup pretty easy at first. I followed all instructions exactly and got the camera connected very easily, then the problems started.My router is a Comcast Xfinity SMC router/modem combo I usually get between 20-50mbps download speeds on my network and never have issues with any other devices. The camera appeared to lag (around 4 seconds on audio/video). Then the video started to work real-time, yet the audio was 1-2 seconds behind (not a huge deal).When you initially set up the camera it must be via Ethernet cable directly hooked up to your router. After I rebooted the camera like instructed and hooked it up via Wi-Fi, that's when the serious issues took place. I moved the camera into the baby room (15 ft. from the router) and the video would either freeze or completely drop. The app used for android devices is the "TinyCam Monitor Pro" ($3.99 at the play store). The camera would connect, then fail, then connect and finally I was unable to connect at all. This is a HUGE problem and a MAJOR bug in the camera! If the camera freezes, you don't get notified at all. Your video and audio just no longer work. If you are relying on this for peace of mind, this is a deal breaker for me.Then there is the issue of the "night vision" mode. My camera was set to auto for all modes, yet the night vision mode would come on randomly even when there was adequate light in the room. Also, as other people have stated, the audible sound the camera makes when switching to night vision is loud and could disturb your baby.Next issue was the nanny cam set up. This is the reason I actually chose this camera over others. I followed all instructions, my router even states it supports UnPn, yet it wouldn't communicate with the camera. I tried the port forwarding thing and everything appeared to check out okay until I actually tried to view the external URL that you use to view it in Nanny Cam mode. This process would not be possible IMO for a person that isn't tech savvy.Bottom line: I will give support a chance to try and fix my issues; if I am not satisfied with functionality and reliability after that I will be returning this camera. I will post an update after I speak to the support team (going on 24 hrs. now of waiting).UPDATE: 4/16/14:  Called customer support, set up a screen share/phone call to fix my issues.  The tech was very helpful and fixed the nanny cam feature rather easy.  I then moved the camera to the baby's room (15 ft away from the router) and it wouldn't work, or when it did it was terribly unreliable.  We checked the settings and the camera was getting 4/5 bars for WiFi.  The tech couldn't troubleshoot the issue, so I had to request an RMA.  I had to put ANOTHER $200 deposit down so they will mail the replacement unit out before they receive my defective unit. So as of today I am out $459 and still don't have a working camera.  I will update again when I receive the replacement.UPDATE: 4/22/14:  Received my 2nd WiFi Baby camera today, set up an appointment with customer support and they were helpful. I had the exact same issues with this camera.  It freezes ALOT, this is a HUGE issue if I am using it for the safety of my daughter.  I would not trust this device to be reliable at all.The tech said it was probably my router that was the issue, not the camera.  I would say that his assessment was plausible if my other 10 wireless devices didn't work flawlessly or the speedtest.net didn't show 10 MBPS + download at the furthest distance from the router.  I am returning this item and will be getting a camera/monitor that is stand alone with the ability to be used over WiFi.I would NOT recommend this "made in China" junk to anyone, FYI if you search the internet there are SEVERAL other cameras that are the exact same with a different name on them.  The company even said their "manufacturer" makes the Y-cam among other brands.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant!
Reviews.Author: Sonny
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely mad for this baby monitor/nanny cam! It's easy to use, setup, and uber convenient! I love that I can see that my kids are tucked in while I'm out to dinner. I was having issues setting up my away mode and an incredibly quick and easy phone call with Gary at tech support fixed my issue in less than five minutes. It's safe to say that I'm a WiFi Baby fan!

Reviews.Title: Real reviews?
Reviews.Author: Simply Me
Reviews.Content: It appears that all but one of the 5-star ratings are from NON-Amazon Verified reviewers. On the other hand, those that actually purchase via Amazon gave much lower ratings and reviews.This is suspect..

Reviews.Title: Quick and Easy to get re-set up
Reviews.Author: Skye Manders
Reviews.Content: Our family moved from DC to Seattle and had to re-set up our monitor.  I contacted Gary who had helped me before and he responded super quick.  Because it was setting it up a 2nd time, it cost $20...but what a deal IMO.  We scheduled a time for him to call, he called exactly on time, and in about 10 minutes we were up and running again.  Thanks Gary!

Reviews.Title: worked, then didn't.  waiting on support
Reviews.Author: Andrew Trieger
Reviews.Content: I would have said 5 stars, easy enough to setup, reliable which was key for me.I changed wifi networks and it went south.Went back to cabled to set its config, couldnt locate it cabled on the network.reset with the button on the side, no joy. 10 times.no support to call, emailed, they said use the form. filled out the form, waiting for contact, just been a few days.Its about 6 mos old, 2013 version.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Janine P.
Reviews.Content: This camera has the best night time viewing I have ever seen.  I've been searching for a camera with a crisp screen and I have found it!  The installation wasn't bad when I set it up on my home network, but I did have a little problem setting it up for viewing outside of my network.  Luckily, Gary from technical support was able to help me out and everything is working perfectly now!  Now my son's grandparents can check in on their sleeping grandson.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound!
Reviews.Author: Michael Franco
Reviews.Content: I had a problem at first setting up. Probably was on my part.  Eric was able to get me going and we really enjoy the camera. The app seems to be performing well. So we are happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Jarred
Reviews.Content: I got my Wifi Baby Monitor this week and had a tough time setting it up.I opened a support ticket and received a quick response to set up a live join.me screen sharing appointment.I was able to schedule the appointment on a Sunday morning, which is very helpful when you work long weekdays.The support technician was extremely patient and polite. He answered all my questions and got everything up and running.He had some trouble setting up an audio feature on the Android third party application, but told me will speak with another technician and get back to me asap. If the product ends up being as good as the customer service, I will be extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: VANESSA HADLEY
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting a month and a half to actually use this camera. Customer service was friendly and said that the issue I was having wirelessly was not the camera but because of my wireless router SOOOO I had my IT guy come in and set up a brand new wireless router (which I will add took longer than expected) and it STILL does not work correctly. I have a very large home and I need this for our little one's bedroom but thus far still can't get it to work. It may not be the camera but if I supposedly purchased one of the strongest routers and this camera still doesn't pick it up then I have wasted my money. At this time customer support has not called me back to resolve the problem but now I'm regretting that I was waiting to see if they could fix the problem because now I can't return it. What a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Great but wish it could do more
Reviews.Author: tweetyoc
Reviews.Content: Love how easy it was to set up. The video and sound quality is awesome. If I was the product mgr for wiFi baby, I would add the following features: 1) be able to move the camera remotely. 2) be able to read the temperature in the room 3) be able to communicate remote

Reviews.Title: Wifi Baby almost worked well!!
Reviews.Author: David Bustos
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to watch over my desktop computer. However the browser plug in that the wifi cam uses doesn't refresh properly so after 3-8 minutes the camera will freeze.. They told me to get the phone app but i bought it to watch from my desk not on my phone.Good in theory but don't purchase it unless you are going to use it over your phone.

Reviews.Title: Utterly unreliable
Reviews.Author: Matt Doyle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought the WiFi Baby 3 as a replacement for the Infant Optics DXR-5, which works without a hitch but interferes with our wifi. We used the WB3 for less than a week before returning it. We tried using it both over wireless and connected to wired ethernet, along with the WiFi Baby iPhone app. I'm not sure if the problem is with the camera or the app, but regardless, the end result is choppy, laggy video, app freezes, and generally unreliable behavior. Even viewing the video stream via web browser proved to be worse than useless, as the video would always halt within minutes, if not seconds.

Reviews.Title: Works really well. Support is Excellent.
Reviews.Author: JaySan
Reviews.Content: I would have given it 5 stars, but the documentation is a bit weak for full setup (both internal and external access). The phone support is outstanding. While online support is important, I use phone support as a benchmark and it was top notch.

Reviews.Title: Jumpy picture, inadequate sound
Reviews.Author: Stevens
Reviews.Content: Despite having a very strong internet connection, this monitor always had at least a 5 second delay from real time, and it would regularly disconnect due to a lost signal (even if you had not moved an inch). In addition, the sound alerts in the Baby Monitor app (an additional $10 for each device) did not work, and the volume level was completely inadequate. The only way this would wake us up at night was if it was plugged into a docking station with speakers and the volume on max level. And, set-up was incredibly time consuming if you needed port forwarding.  We ended up returning after a few weeks of use and repeated disappointment.  I gave 2 stars (instead of 1) because it was nice to be able to log in from outside of the home, but this feature was rarely used.

Reviews.Title: Helpful
Reviews.Author: White Haired Lady
Reviews.Content: It is helpful to be able to see what is going on in the room.  It is not very clear at night, but you can still see!  The sound is not good, and I would have liked to have two cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great product - Excellent Support
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: We've had the Wi-Fi Baby camera since mid-2011 and have been very pleased,  It works as expected almost every time and the couple times it hasn't, all due to networking issues, Gary from support has been there to assist by setting up a webinar and configuring MY network routers and such to get it corrected.  I gave it four stars for a couple of reasons.  I don't like the fact that there's no windows phone app and also the fact that an app doesn't come with the camera and that it is $15!

Reviews.Title: Great service
Reviews.Author: Natspad
Reviews.Content: I had a problem setting up my camera, I contacted wifi baby and they were so helpful. Problem was solve in minutes. We use the nanny cam all the time. It is so great to have!!!

Reviews.Title: Flakey, and you have to pay for app on top of everything
Reviews.Author: Callum Lawson
Reviews.Content: Advertised as giving you capability of monitoring your baby remotely, however the capability was not even reliable in my house.To start with, after paying $250 for the equipment, you shouldn't  then be expected to pay an extra $12 to download the app on your mobile device - each new device requires a payment of $12.  To add to this, the App is terrible.  Wifi in my house is good, however the app struggled to give me full coverage at home, and kept dropping out.  When I tried to go offsite, it didn't work at all.This is a great idea, and something I was really excited about using, however the app associated with the product requires significant improvements to make this product worthwhile.  I returned my device for refund (but there is no way to refund the cost of purchasing the app on 2 devices)

Reviews.Title: Amazing customer service
Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: After an extremely frustrating experience with the Withings monitor, I almost threw in the towel with wifi monitors, but I decided to give the wifi baby a try.  So far, so good!  The video quality is 10 times better than the Withings (a "tip" for the Withings is that your video will be clearer if you don't place it on front of a white or light colored wall...seriously?!?!).  The setup with Wifi Baby MAY be slightly trickier than Withings, but I think it's because they offer more customizable features (like being able to "squelch" out background or white noise in the room and only hear noises above a set volume, recording, alarms, etc).  However, the setup difficulty is a non-issue because of Wifi Baby's amazing customer service (Withings doesn't even offer a phone number to call someone directly- you have to submit thru an email and then wait for THEM to get back to YOU...which for me took about a week while I had no functioning monitor for my baby).  Tonight, I spoke with Eric at Wifi Baby who was extremely helpful, patient, thorough, friendly and at the end of the day (I hate that saying...but it literally was 10:30 at night) he was able to resolve my issue and educate me all about the monitor.  EXACTLY what a customer service professional should be.  It is so refreshing when a company has excellent customer service- it is very hard to find these day, but it goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: Technical support.
Reviews.Author: Toyin Ajisafe
Reviews.Content: I got off the phone with a support personnel a few hours ago. Initially, I had to complete a service ticket online in order to be matched up with an agent; however, the process was so seamless and efficient. The agent was prompt, professional, and resolved my issue within minutes of initiating the screen sharing. I have a 2013 WiFi baby 3, and my wife and I love it.

Reviews.Title: Traveling mom peace of mind!
Reviews.Author: Leigh
Reviews.Content: I originally planned on purchasing the angel care monitor, but after doing more research, the Baby Wifi 3G seemed more fitting for our family's needs. I travel often for my job and being able to see my sleeping pr playing son really makes leaving him a little more palatable.My husband is pretty tech savvy but we couldn't get the "away" function to work properly. A quick phone call to the company, and Jeff was on it in no time. After sharing my screen (with unbinding patience!) he adroitly navigated through the systems we have in place, got us up and running on MULTIPLE devices (3 iPhones, 3 iPads, etc). The "away" function will only work with the add-on purchase of the app, but, for me, it's a well worth while, nominal purchase to be able to use this function. Baby Wifi 3G is the only monitor I found where this is even an option. There are some reviews complaining about having to pay for the app, but it should be noted that they are 2 different companies. It's all of $10. If you're paying the higher price for this adaptable monitor, it's just another $10, though NOT required if you're just using at home.On my first work trip post-maternity leave, and post-Jeff's set-up, I couldn't get the "away" feature to work. Naturally, I wanted to speak with the same person who helped me the first time. Jeff's fantastic follow up email after our first call gave me the opportunity to send him a quick email to ask for help. He called right away (I had just landed!) and figured out that I had transposed one of the numbers in the access codes. Bingo! He had me looking in the  nursery while sitting in my rental car parking lot!The picture quality is excellent,even on night vision. I can EVEN view from 30,000 miles in the air with the go-go in flight wifi.We initially had the camera pretty close to the crib so we could see his facial features, but the night vision strobe seemed invasive for our son. So, we mounted it on the wall and can see more of the room. It's easy to zoom in on the ipad to see more detail.Our son is adopted, so when our social worker came for a follow up visit, she was blown away by the picture quality and detail. She even wrote down the brand information so she could recommend to other adoptive families.The customer service alone makes this a 5 star review! Thanks Baby Wifi 3G and Jeff!!!

Reviews.Title: Great cam, effortless set-up
Reviews.Author: LBeezy6
Reviews.Content: I've been using the camera for a couple of months now, and it does what a great baby cam is supposed to - wireless, night time, sound, various device options, viewing from home and away, etc. But it's best feature by far is the set-up support offered by the WiFi Baby team. Gary was available immediately, endlessly knowledgeable, and professional. I would buy this again, and have been recommending it to all of my friends. Effortless tech experience - it simply works. Mind you, I immediately sought tech support because I knew I had a complex wireless network set-up that was beyond my own tech abilities. If you're intimidated by potential set-up issues - don't worry. Simply email WiFi Baby and they will do it all for you in a flash.

Reviews.Title: Best support service I could ask for
Reviews.Author: Kyoung
Reviews.Content: The wifi baby monitor is new to me- but so far so good. I have difficulty with initial set up- but it was due to my old computer and lack of computer knowledge - Jeff with support service was amazing. Within hours he had scheduled an appt with me, explained in simple terms the set up and walked me through the process within 20 minutes. He also got me all set up in my iPad and iPhone. Exceptional support with a real person. So now we are loving out new monitor.

Reviews.Title: Very Versitile Monitor, and Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Spartan 1999 X
Reviews.Content: I received the monitor and easily set it up so that I could view the video on my iPhone with the purchased app.  I ran into some trouble viewing the video on our MAC and remotely on my iphone.  I visited the Wifi Baby website and submitted a help ticket.  A representative quickly contacted me via email to set-up a web-share meeting.  The nice thing is that they will set-up appointments in the evening and on weekends.  Eric from support contacted me and set-up a web-share meeting.  Viewing the video through my Safari browser wasn't working, so we tried Google Chrome and it came right up.  For remote viewing (outside the home on cell network), Eric quickly help me set-up my router.  Everything was resolved, and I really like the versatility of this monitor.  I will set-up my wife's phone next, so we will both have a monitor.

Reviews.Title: Good product, easy to setup
Reviews.Author: Shu Yan
Reviews.Content: Good product, easy to setup, I was having a little problem so I called the customer service, great help from Jeff, guide me step to step, also helped me to installed on my iPad! Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: Gary is amazing!
Reviews.Author: New Wife
Reviews.Content: I love the WiFi baby camera for many reasons but the support I got from Gary was by far the best thing about this product! We had an issue with the first camera we received but Gary helped me get it figured out within a day (on a weekend) and sent me the information to exchange it. Our new camera came within the week and Gary helped me get it set up! Amazing!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Image, but not great for overnight usage
Reviews.Author: Parisgreen "Parisgreen"
Reviews.Content: The GoodThe image quality is great. And it goes to night vision without a problem.The sound quality is okay.It was really easy to install and hang.The customer service was very polite and attentive.This is a great monitor if you are just checking in every once in a while from away from home.The BadIt is extremely expensive and then there is the additional cost for the app.There is a substantial lag between when something happens and it is transmitted through the internet to the monitor, can be as long as 5 seconds.As a monitor to keep on all night, it isn't great because if for some reason your internet cuts out, which living in NY and dealing with Time Warner happens all the time, it will just shut off and you have to refresh it to turn it back on.The iPhone app has a weird glitch that if you turn it on the iPhone's side the picture goes away. So you have to keep it super still and upright the whole night which isn't easy when you are groggy and just want a closer look.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product with amazing customer service.
Reviews.Author: Haley
Reviews.Content: If you are not tech savy- no worries! Schedule an appointment to screen share and wifibaby's amazing will have you up & running in no time!

Reviews.Title: Expensive but well worth it!!
Reviews.Author: MELISSA
Reviews.Content: I purchased several other wifi monitors before this one that just didn't do the job.  I am very pleased with this camera! It fits my needs for watching my babies while I'm at work however, my husband would love it if it had a monitor.  Pan/tilt feature would be nice also but it is the best functioning camera I have found yet. I would like to purchase another but at $300 each, we will just make due with one. It would be nice if the company supplied a coupon inside the packaging if you wish to purchase multiple cameras.  It is true you get what you pay for.... And I am very very  happy with this camera!!  We have had it a little over a month and had absolutely no problems with it thus far.

Reviews.Title: Great Wifi Camera!
Reviews.Author: SK
Reviews.Content: This was given to us as a gift from a friend. It is one of the best gifts we have received!  The picture and audio quality are great and it is extremely reliable.  Having the camera has given me peace of mind to be able to return to work and know I can check on the baby whenever I need to.  Customer support is GREAT! I used them to help setup my camera and for 2 minor issues since then.  I always receive a response almost immediately (even on the weekend) and have always been able to setup a phone appointment the same or next day.  Email responses are always quick and helpful.  You are put in touch with someone directly that helps until your problem is solved - very personal service.  They call and screen share and talk you through what they are doing so if the problem comes up again you can troubleshoot for yourself.  EXTREMELY happy with the support and camera.  Can't say enough about it.

Reviews.Title: Great tech support!
Reviews.Author: Sue C
Reviews.Content: Love this nanny-cam...had a little trouble setting up the remote viewing but the tech support was second to none-Gary helped me resolve the issue within about 15 minutes-it has been working perfectly ever since.

Reviews.Title: baby wifi new for 2014
Reviews.Author: GARY YOST
Reviews.Content: Hello, I`m writing today to say I received my camera on a Sunday.  i was having trouble setting it up. i called the help line tech support. I talked to Gary. he was Great. the camera works good but i have a long internet lag time from the camera to the cell phone. also the same with using the pc. long lag time. maybe it`s my internet, not sure. but the camera works good and the picture is good. the more light in the room, the better picture you get.

Reviews.Title: Unreal customer service...thanks Eric!!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: We got the 2013/2.0 model as a hand-me-down from a friend, and had trouble getting it running.  As I hadn't purchased it new, I was reluctant to call customer service.  However, I gave it a shot, and they were amazing!  It was after-hours, so I left a message.  Eric called me back the following evening, after I got home from work.  He was extremely patient while I got everything set back up, and then worked with me for almost an hour, total!  He never got frustrated, and in fact, stayed on the line with me afterward, and helped me tweak my settings.  Unreal.  This guy seemed to genuinely enjoy the troubleshooting.  It's been a long time since I can remember having such good customer support.  Way to stand behind your product, Eric!  (Btw, the problem was with our crappy router...not the monitor)

Reviews.Title: My 2nd purchase
Reviews.Author: Gen
Reviews.Content: This is my second review for wifibaby cameras. I purchased one last year when my daughter was born. I was so impressed by the camera and their customer service, I purchased another one!!And as usual, I was not disappointed. Roger helped me setup my second camera and it works seamlessly!! I love that I can monitor my two toddler sons in their room, while I can also see my daughter in her room. I also appreciate the option of logging into my home wifi when I'm away and see my children in real time through my iPhone and ipad. Love this company!!!

Reviews.Title: Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Samuel Sihapong
Reviews.Content: WiFi Baby provides great customer, and technical support for their product. I recently had an issue with my cameras, where I was unable to view remotely. I contacted WiFi baby technical support, and recieved a response within a couple of hours. I love that they are willing to work with your sechedule; especially after 6:00pm.Roger Leo was the technical support guy, and walked me through the set up process. He trouble shot the problem with the dual porting settings, and was able to resolve the issue. He was very patient with me, due to the fact that I was not familiar with the settings of my home network.

Reviews.Title: fantastic service
Reviews.Author: Bob W.
Reviews.Content: contacted tech support, got back with me as promised.  excellent support. highly reccomend this product.very polite and patient tech rep.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: Bryan S
Reviews.Content: Camera is awesome.  Customer service is even better.  Networking isn't an easy process but I called and set an appointment and the representative that called me back had it up and running within 15 minutes.  Great picture night or day, viewable on your wireless devices(phone, iPad, etc.) so battery life is good.  Would buy again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Simply mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace our existing baby cam with monitor that was going bad. Have to admit I was skeptical. The day I got it, I was discouraged. I couldn't get my PC to recognize the camera to even go through the wizard. So I can't acted the support line. He was awesome!!!! Truly, he went above and beyond to help. He not only got me up and running, he fixed a few issues I had and helped with the away feature. Just for anyone who doesn't understand, you do need to connect the camera for initial setup and once it's done, all you need is an outlet! We monitor through our IPhones and iPads. The app was an additional cost of $11.99, to us, a small price compared to batteries or replacement batteries and will be great went warm weather hits and we are outside where our old monitor never reached! We love it and would recommend it to everyone, worth the $$$. Thanks tech support you are awesome!!

Reviews.Title: We hate this monitor
Reviews.Author: Ryan Nass
Reviews.Content: We really hate this monitor and had to return it after using it for a week. As far as the app goes, you are able to click out of the app and put your phone to sleep while keeping the sound of the monitor on; however, the volume drops significantly and you can barely hear it. Second, a monitor at this price should really have temperature included. Instead, you have to purchase an extra third-party thermometer to link to the app. Third, the app that you need to use this monitor costs $13- That is ridiculous! Despite all of these things (most we learned when we first installed it), we decided to still give it a try. It disconnects more often than it stays connected through the night. Our wifi service and signal have no issues. We have used other wifi monitors and have not had as many disconnect issues as we had with this monitor. We had to send it back. Very disappointed with this product.

Reviews.Title: This is great! When it actually works...
Reviews.Author: CMD
Reviews.Content: The problem here is not really the camera, it's the app and connection. When it is connected, the monitor is great. Great quality video, wide angle, good with noise detection, etc. The app crashes or doesn't connect all of the time. We actually bought another monitor (motorola video) to have as backup and for when we travel. Since I started working 2 weeks ago, I would say 75% of the time I try to view my baby's room using the app I am unable to connect. That is not a good %. We got a 2nd one to use as a 'nanny cam' in the living room (but really so I can watch my baby from work when he's playing) but will likely return it because it's not reliable (that said, we don't really want to start a whole new system here so we may just deal with faulty connectivity.) Customer service is great, but unfortunately it would be extremely time consuming to call every time the app fails to connect. It actually kind of amazes me that with today's tech advances, there is no really good wifi baby monitor/nanny cam option. Seems like such a basic thing. My 2 dings on the camera itself are: it does not pan or tilt, so while it's a 'wide screen' you can't move the view remotely like you can on the Motorola digital video monitor, and second, the infrared lights around the camera are pretty bright and often our baby stares at it (keeping him awake - but I should add, once we hung the camera on the wall, further away from the crib, this seemed to stop happening... so make sure to position the camera a few feet away from the crib.) In summary, I don't know if you should buy this. We obviously kept it instead of returning it, but the connectivity seems to be getting worse the longer we have it (which is only about a month now.) I guess we decided some out of area connectivity is better than none, and based on what I've heard this is still better than most of the wifi options out there. Oh last thing - it definitely works better when we are at home connecting. Most of the non-connectivity happens when we are trying to access remotely.

Reviews.Title: An expensive mistake
Reviews.Author: MAQ "IRRegular User"
Reviews.Content: Had this product for over a week now but I am still unable to set it up. One would guess that for the price you pay, the company would actually invest some money on the software to make setting it up and configuring it easy. Nowadays, smart communication technology is everywhere, and configuration should not be more than two or three clicks. Instead, the company is still in the dark ages with this software and it takes many steps to configure and still you get many problems along the way. I tried the software on windows 7 and 8 but still the same. After completing the software installation process I get a page telling me "cannot find the page", so live feed is not possible. Repeated and repeated and repeated the process but no chance. I cannot comment on the quality of the product itself because i have not reached that stage yet. It seems that I will require an IT developer to configure it for me. I WISH I have NOT Wasted my MONEY on WiFi Baby

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!!
Reviews.Author: Judy Westbrook
Reviews.Content: I have a disabled daughter and this camera has allowed me to move about more freely while keeping an eye on her.And anyone needing tech support to set everything up, don't hesitate to make that contact. My experience was super good.

Reviews.Title: I would recommend this product to any traveling parent!
Reviews.Author: esob
Reviews.Content: I just got off of the phone with a VERY helpful and friendly Tech Support. I would recommend calling as soon as you have the software installed. They can remotely set you up and verify a secure network visible on both network and wifi channels. Jeff P was exceptional and friendly with the set up and helped me set the device up on my tablet and phones as well. It didn't take long and I now have the security of being a traveling Mom with the ability to check in on my little one. Thank you Wifi Baby!

Reviews.Title: I wouldn't recommend it for new parents
Reviews.Author: Melissa McDonald
Reviews.Content: As far as cameras go, this is a nice camera. The monitor is clear, sound is great, and it is nice to be able to dim the monitor when you are sleeping at night.Here are some things I didn't think about until the camera arrived, and everyday make me regret returning the summer monitor that we originally had:Things I like:-I like that you can view when you are away from the house.-I especially like the audio monitor. You can see noises and can dissect if they are just baby grunts, or real cries.Things I don't like:-This seems intuitative, but you can only view it on your phone, ipad, or computer. Now, that's nice, except for when you want to use your phone. And if your household doesn't have with an iPad, or a land line, you're screwed. Also, if you have a nanny and you leave, does she have to spend the $12 to get the app? It's not really the most...convenient monitor on the market.-There is a loud clicking noise when the camera transfers between night vision and day vision. You'd think it wouldn't disrupt the babies, but it does.Honestly, the fact that you have to spend $12 on an app for this, and you are tethered to your phone--makes me hate it and wish I had never purchased it. It's an absurd amount of money for what it does.

Reviews.Title: Not the best...
Reviews.Author: nicolelising
Reviews.Content: Eh. I loved the Baby Ping, and will end up getting a new version of that. This one is too complicated for what its worth... Plus you have to buy a $12 app??? Bleh.
